messages.subject: Re: Re: 2 for 1
messages.msgSnippet: I used to live in Knoxville and went through the same situation with the umbrella school.  We HAD to use a church school for it.  We found one that did not
messages.messageBody:
I used to live in Knoxville and went through the same situation with the
umbrella school. We HAD to use a church school for it. We found one that
did not require us to sign a statement agreeing with them on religious issues
but this still really bothered me. I felt that it was a violation of the
separation of church and state for Tennessee to only allow the umbrella
schools to be church schools. I wish someone would take them to court on it.
I made phone calls about it to various groups but didn't get anywhere at the
time.

Lucy in Calif.

messages.subject: Re: Re: 2 for 1
messages.msgSnippet: I can t be any umbrella school -- it must be a Church-related school as defined by TCA. ::sigh:: Jacki List mom Tennhomeschoolers email list ... -- It is
messages.messageBody:
I can't be any "umbrella school" -- it must be a Church-related school as defined by TCA. ::sigh::

Jacki
List mom Tennhomeschoolers email list


MORELFAM@... wrote:
>
> From: MORELFAM@...
>
> In a message dated 11/6/99 12:21:33 PM, LisaBugg@... writes:
>
> << Question #1: I had someone ask me about TN homeschool requirement for
>
> > grade 9-12 that parent must have certification or degree? Can this be
>
> > worked around by using American School or some type of umbrella type
>
> > program? >>
>
> only one parent needs a degree and that is if you are registered with the
> county to homeschool. if you are registered with an "umbrella school" it is
> treated like a private school in which you are a teacher, it is not regulated
> by the state.
> erin
>
> > Check it out!
> http://www.unschooling.com

--
It is better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
Education is not the filling of a bucket but the lighting of a fire.
If you have knowledge let others light their candles by it.
We shall light a candle of understanding in our hearts which shall not be put out.

messages.subject: Re: Re: 2 for 1
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/6/99 12:21:33 PM, LisaBugg@unschooling.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/6/99 12:21:33 PM, LisaBugg@... writes:

<< Question #1: I had someone ask me about TN homeschool requirement for

> grade 9-12 that parent must have certification or degree? Can this be

> worked around by using American School or some type of umbrella type

> program? >>

only one parent needs a degree and that is if you are registered with the
county to homeschool. if you are registered with an "umbrella school" it is
treated like a private school in which you are a teacher, it is not regulated
by the state.
erin
